snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry and the Russian foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, met to discuss disputes over the talks, which are scheduled to begin Monday.
abstract: American and Russian diplomats meeting in Zurich fail to agree on who will represent opposition days before peace talks aimed at ending Syrian civil war are set to start; officials fear Pres Bashar al-Assad, whose position has bolstered position by Russian military support, will be less inclined to compromise.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, Helene Cooper from Brussels, and Michael S. Schmidt from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry and the Russian foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, met to discuss disputes over the talks, which are scheduled to begin Monday.

headline.main: Squabbles Persist Over Who Should Be at Syria Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: As Syrian Peace Talks Near, U.S. and Russia Can’t Agree on the Participants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
